introduction: Hey there — I'm a frontend engineer and product designer with over five years of professional experience and a degree in computer science. I mostly specialise in React/Redux stacks, but I also have experience with Vue, Angular, and Ember.js. I've worked in various industries, including: artificial intelligence, healthcare, and genomics. I became involved in frontend engineering as the perfect way to blend my interests in engineering principles and utilising my keen eye for design.
currently: Currently, I'm working at Filament AI as the Lead Frontend Engineer, where I design and build the frontend architecture for AP and Machine Learning solutions.

content: Leads the direction of frontend architecture and implementation across Filament AI products and solutions. Responsibilities include: leading the development processes, product design, and implementation of various projects; ownership and maintenance of the in-house UI component library and design system; managing and conducting code reviews for other frontend developers; and, making general frontend technology decisions in order to maintain high quality and modern code.

As the lead frontend engineer and product designer, most of my time is spent building Syfter.ai - a highly scalable platform designed to help clients gain insights on their company universe using an intuitive dashboard, a multitude of data sources and articles from around the web, and also utilising internal machine learning models.

I am also the creator and lead maintainer of our in-house UI component library, Filament UI, which is used throughout the company in all of our web applications. This project acted both as a library of re-usable React components and a highly customisable design system, useful for creating rich applications of any scale.

As part of the Filament Solutions team, I was responsible for designing and building Filament Dash, a knowledge management dashboard designed to help companies gain insights on their data pool. During this time, I also steered the company's frontend technological solutions to a more modern and sustainable React/Redux stack, while helping to maintain and transition any legacy projects.

Alongside my full-time role, I have also provided frontend development and product design services as a freelancer. Notable projects include designing, building, and maintaining the entire frontend architecture of an e-learning platform for medical and dental students. As a freelancer, I have worked closely with clients, transforming business requirements into high-fidelity designs as well as building scalable platforms that work for a large user base.

After my initial placement year with Repositive, I continued to work within their development team throughout my final year at university, on a mostly remote basis. During this time I made contributions to the ongoing development of the data discovery platform and helped to conduct code reviews for the Ember.js code base.

Joining Repositive in a junior role as part of my industrial placement year, I worked with a small team to help build an initial release of their data discovery platform for researchers within the field of genomics. I worked closely with other developers and designed to gain a great understanding of development processes, while benefiting from the opportunity to contribute heavily to the code base. Through my many opportunities to attend conferences on technology and science, I learned a great deal about the industry, as well as the importance of establishing and maintaining good relationships with peers.

list.text: Computer Science with a Year in Industry

list.linkText: Building Ambitious Web Applications with Ember.js
